Title: Journal Page III
Text:
Day 17.

We waded through marshland to reach this waterlogged ruin, only to find more disappointment. The knights are losing faith—some doubt we'll ever find this so-called relic. Ennio, who's as close as family to me, stood against my decision to move on. He accused me of straying from the righteous path.

There was no other way to settle it; we dueled, as the knight's creed demands. He cast the gauntlets over to me, his mentor. Our duel ended amidst a strange howl from afar. When he fell, a part of me fell with him.

Ennio... He was set on the ideals of knighthood but was blind to the cold reality facing our branch of the family. I can feel it now—fortune and glory lie to the north. Porto-Veno Castle will have to honor our deeds.

At this point, there's no turning back.
